decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Unnumbered Existing Elevations; Unnumbered Planning Statement - March 2017; 506 - Site Photos as Existing. Received: Received: 27/03/2017.
Unnumbered Existing Floor Plans; Unnumbered Proposed Flood Plans. Received: 30/03/2017.
BULW/17/3722/TS01 - Transport Statement: Received: 20/06/2017.
Unnumbered Ground Floor Plans incorporating Buggy Park. Received: 31/07/2017.) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - The use hereby permitted shall not be begun until details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.
Condition : 4 - No deliveries shall be taken at or despatched from the site outside the hours of [7:00am - 5:00pm] nor at any time on Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays.

Condition : 5 - The premises shall be used for Nursery/Museum/Art Gallery and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class D1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).

Condition : 6 - Prior to occupation of the building, a Travel Plan that includes proactive targets, measures and an action plan to reduce car travel, particularly car borne staff trips, and targets for modal share shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - The use of the building within Use Class A3 (Food and Drink) shall not be open to customers outside of the following hours:
9:00am to 11:00pm Monday to Saturdays; 11:00am to 10:30pm Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Condition : 8 - The use of the building within Use Class D1 (Nursery/Art Gallery/Museum) shall not be open to customers outside of the following hours: 7:00am - 9:00pm Mondays to Fridays; 9:00am-9:00pm Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays.
Condition : 9 - No amplified speech or foreground music shall be played on the premises.
Condition : 10 - Matters relating to the control of noise and fumes shall be maintained in accordance with the details approved under permission 00074/1-4/P5(E) on 24/01/2006.

Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, (or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) and the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) - no change of use from use class B1(a) Office to C3 (Dwellinghouse) shall take place without the specific grant of planning permission from the Local Planning Authority for such development.
description: Change of use from A3 to flexible use classes comprising A3 (Food and Drink), B1 (Business) and D1 (Nursery/Art Gallery/Museum).
